subject: Inviting your contribution to the first issue of Patterns
body:
The science of data - Patterns is a premium open access journal from Cell Press, publishing ground-breaking original research across the full breadth of data science. Data are the foundation of all research, and all data are in scope, regardless of original domain.

 http://communications.elsevier.com/r/?id=t2a9542a0,6102f923,373f40d9&utm_campaign=STMJ_99751_CALLP_OA&utm_medium=email&utm_dgroup=99751_SCO-EXT_AB3-TSSH_SGL_ALL&utm_acid=323984814&SIS_ID=-1&dgcid=STMJ_99751_CALLP_OA&CMX_ID=&utm_in=DM588586&utm_source=AC_7 	

Patterns  is a new open access journal from Cell Press, publishing high-quality, ground-breaking original research across the full breadth of data science. Data are the foundation of all research, and all data are in scope, regardless of original domain. Patterns  brings together research from across domains in academia and industry to: 

 	share knowledge about how to best develop and run data science infrastructures, tools, and services 	

 	communicate solutions and best practices for data science algorithms and methodologies 	

 	discuss the human and environmental impact of decisions made using data science 	

 	develop new cross-disciplinary methods for efficient data analysis, processing, archiving, and use 	

	 http://communications.elsevier.com/r/?id=t2a9542a0,6102f923,373f40da&utm_campaign=STMJ_99751_CALLP_OA&utm_medium=email&utm_dgroup=99751_SCO-EXT_AB3-TSSH_SGL_ALL&utm_acid=323984814&SIS_ID=-1&dgcid=STMJ_99751_CALLP_OA&CMX_ID=&utm_in=DM588586&utm_source=AC_7 Explore Patterns 		
	

We are calling for submissions from a broad spectrum of data-intensive disciplines and research fields across academia, industry, and policy: 

 	Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning 	

 	Big Data 	

 	Data Analytics and Statistics 	

 	Data Collection, Aggregation, and Management 	

 	Software and Algorithms 	
	  	
 	Data Infrastructures, Tools, and Services 	

 	Data Intensive Research 	

 	Data Policy and Ethics 	

 	Informatics 	

 	Metadata, Semantics, and Ontologies 	

  	  	
	
	

	 http://communications.elsevier.com/r/?id=t2a9542a0,6102f923,373f40db&utm_campaign=STMJ_99751_CALLP_OA&utm_medium=email&utm_dgroup=99751_SCO-EXT_AB3-TSSH_SGL_ALL&utm_acid=323984814&SIS_ID=-1&dgcid=STMJ_99751_CALLP_OA&CMX_ID=&utm_in=DM588586&utm_source=AC_7 Share your data story. The science of data - Patterns is a premium open access journal from Cell Press, publishing ground-breaking original research across the full breadth of data science. Data are the foundation of all research, and all data are in scope, regardless of original domain.

Patterns is a new open access journal from Cell Press, publishing high-quality, ground-breaking original research across the full breadth of data science. Data are the foundation of all research, and all data are in scope, regardless of original domain. Patterns brings together research from across domains in academia and industry to:




share knowledge about how to best develop and run data science infrastructures, tools, and services







communicate solutions and best practices for data science algorithms and methodologies







discuss the human and environmental impact of decisions made using data science







develop new cross-disciplinary methods for efficient data analysis, processing, archiving, and use









Explore Patterns










We are calling for submissions from a broad spectrum of data-intensive disciplines and research fields across academia, industry, and policy: 
          







Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning








Big Data








Data Analytics and Statistics








Data Collection, Aggregation, and Management








Software and Algorithms



 




Data Infrastructures, Tools, and Services








Data Intensive Research








Data Policy and Ethics








Informatics








Metadata, Semantics, and Ontologies







 
 

















Share your data story. Submit your paper today.
